description.plain:
Noah Kahan is an indie folk-pop singer/songwriter hailing from Strafford, Vermont. who has made a name for himself in the music world, drawing in listeners with his soulful voice, heartfelt lyrics, and a unique mix of folk, pop, and indie vibes.

Being a musician since childhood, Kahan always had that dream of making music his job. But it took him a long time to get there. The early stage of his career was characterized by playing small shows in front of few people and getting little exposure, as he mentioned in an interview.

In senior year of high school, he started releasing songs online with the help of a producer and friend. Noah’s first officially released single, “Young Blood”, quickly blew up on SoundCloud. His sudden success also caught the attention of Republic Records, and before Noah had even released three tracks, he was signed to a label and was working with the great names of the music industry, such as Joel Little.

In 2018, after releasing his debut EP Hurt Somebody, Noah played lots of concerts, headlining a European tour in spring and a world tour in fall while playing some shows in Australia in between and supporting George Ezra and Leon Bridges on their tours.

In 2019, Kahan released his debut album, Busyhead, featuring songs like “False Confidence” and “Mess,” which explored themes of self-doubt and mental health. Kahan toured extensively that year, establishing himself as a powerful live performer.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Kahan released the acoustic Cape Elizabeth EP in 2021, showcasing a more intimate, stripped-back sound inspired by his Vermont roots.

2022 marked a momentous year for Kahan who reached new heights with the release of Stick Season, an album rooted in his New England upbringing. The title track was first teased on TikTok, becoming a viral sensation almost instantly, while garnering critical acclaim for the raw storytelling and vivid imagery. His subsequent Stick Season Tour sold-out venues both on a national and internation level, expanding his fanbase significantly.

In 2023, Kahan released the deluxe edition of Stick Season (We’ll All Be Here Forever and later Stick Season (Forever), featuring new tracks like “Dial Drunk” and “Forever” as well as collaborations with artists like Post Malone, Sam Fender, Hozier, and Zach Bryan. Kahan’s focus on rural life, mental health, and nostalgia, resonating deeply with listeners and solidifying his place in modern folk and Americana.

Today, Noah Kahan is celebrated as a defining voice of his generation, blending emotional honesty and vivid storytelling with universal relatability, all while staying true to his Vermont roots.

songs.title: Stick Season

description.plain: “Stick Season,” Kahan’s first single from the album of the same name, commemorates a familiar time in his home of Vermont, when the trees are bare and winter threatens. It’s an unsettling time when the narrator reflects on life and the way it could have been.

As you promised me that I was more than all the miles combined
You must've had yourself a change of heart like halfway through the drive
Because your voice trailed off exactly as you passed my exit sign
Kept on drivin' straight and left our future to the right
Now I am stuck between my anger and the blame that I can't face
And memories are somethin' even smoking weed does not replace
And I am terrified of weather 'cause I see you when it rains
Doc told me to travel, but there's Covid on the planes

[Chorus]
And I love Vermont, but it's the season of the sticks
And I saw your mom, she forgot that I existed
And it's half my fault, but I just like to play the victim
I'll drink alcohol 'til my friends come home for Christmas
And I'll dream each night of some version of you
That I might not have, but I did not lose
Now you're tire tracks and one pair of shoes
And I'm split in half, but that'll have to do

[Verse 2]
So I thought that if I piled something good on all my bad
That I could cancel out the darkness I inherited from Dad
No, I am no longer funny 'cause I miss the way you laugh
You once called me "forever," now you still can't call me back

songs.full_title: You’re Gonna Go Far by Noah Kahan
songs.title: You’re Gonna Go Far

description.plain: “You’re Gonna Go Far” is a bittersweet kind of letter from the singer to a loved one, who is finally leaving their hometown. The singer, though saddened by their own mundane life, is happy for their loved one because they’re going to “go far,” and do great things, even without the narrator. The song is meant to tell the person that they shouldn’t feel guilty for leaving home, because they will go far places and do great things and find their own happiness. While there is no particular type of relationship that this song is about, the lyrics are strongly reminiscent of a parent watching their child go off to college, or someone watching their friend move away. Overall, it’s a nostalgic kind of love song (platonic or otherwise) that speaks to the feeling of mundane loneliness, bittersweet love, and the need to let go.

songs.full_title: Call Your Mom by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Call Your Mom

description.plain:
First appearing on Stick Season (We All Be Here Forever), “Call Your Mom” marks one of seven new tracks on the deluxe version of Stick Season.

A deeply emotive song recalling life’s darkest moments, “Call Your Mom” is a heartfelt ballad of unconditional support for those living with mental health issues, particularly depression. It’s not an easy song to perform live, as Noah mentioned on Twitter:

For those asking about ‘Call Your Mom’ live just know that it is difficult for me to perform that one live every night. I’m hoping I learn to perform it with more composure but for now it’s very much a work in progress.

“Call Your Mom” speaks deeply to the struggle with mental health, as Kahan appeals for someone he cares about to choose life over self-harm. His raw lyrics suggest he’s familiar with depression, both through personal battles and through supporting loved ones facing similar struggles. Kahan’s word choice expresses empathy by sharing that he’s “been exactly where you are,” conveying resilience and solidarity.

Kahan touches on the devastating impact of suicidal thoughts on friends and family, recalling waiting in a hospital, fearing for someone he loves. With lines like “If you could see yourself like this, you’d’ve never tried it,” he highlights the lasting effects on those left behind, urging listeners to choose life. The lyrics could be seen as a plea to find any lifeline, as reflected in the bridge, “Medicate, meditate, save your soul for Jesus,” which suggests a mix of seeking help, finding peace, or connecting with something greater to keep going.

songs.full_title: Orange Juice by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Orange Juice

description.plain: It seems Noah is reflecting upon a loved one who got into a traumatic drunk driving accident that was fatal for some passengers. They had left home (New England) and upon coming back, they are struggling with being in the place where everything happened. They can’t comprehend how life could have gone on there afterwards when their own life and identity had been so irrevocably altered by the event. Noah is gently welcoming them back home, telling them there is (the titular) orange juice in the kitchen, so they won’t be driven to the alcohol that so affected them. He provides them an alternative and tries to compassionately drive them towards self-forgiveness.

songs.full_title: Dial Drunk by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Dial Drunk

description.plain:
‘Dial Drunk’ is written from the perspective of a presumed alcoholic who has just been arrested and is using the phone number of someone they had promised to leave alone as their emergency number.
The fictional man refuses to take blame for still contacting them against their wishes, saying his “medicine” (alcohol) has drowned their perspective out.
The chorus of ‘Dial Drunk’ was released on TikTok and quickly went viral.

songs.full_title: Forever by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Forever

description.plain:
“Forever” is distinguished as the sole original track on Noah Kahan’s Stick Season (Forever), the final installment of his globally successful third album.

Noah Kahan first teased the song on September 19, 2023, by posting a video on TikTok of him singing the chorus and a deleted verse. The capitalization of the video’s caption “In The Heat Of July” suggests that that was the original title of the song; however, this has not been confirmed. The video gained an overwhelmingly positive response, quickly surpassing four million views and half a million likes. Shortly after this, on October 8, 2023, Noah Kahan shared a snippet of the second verse, which gained just as much attention as the initial post.

The song debuted during the final American show of Noah Kahan’s 2023 Stick Season Tour in Dallas on October 15, 2023. It was also performed five times during the EU & UK leg of the tour in November 2023 (in Amsterdam, Leeds, Newcastle, Glasgow, and the first of the London shows).

On December 11, 2023, Noah Kahan tweeted that the track had officially been recorded. He has also since implied that “Forever” shares a storyline with previous releases “Stick Season” and “Northern Attitude.”

On January 25, 2024, it was revealed on various social media platforms that “Forever” would make a proper appearance on Stick Season (Forever).

songs.full_title: Homesick by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Homesick

description.plain:
With the title acting as a double entendre to longing for your home but also being sick of said home, “Homesick” finds Kahan wishing to leave New England, but is unable to find any reason to. Kahan reflects on his complex feelings toward small-town life, balancing an appreciation for its history and sense of community with frustration over limited opportunities and stagnation, a common theme that runs throughout the album.

Throughout the song, Kahan explains what it is like to live in a place you long to leave, talking about things that make him tired of the repetitiveness of living in the same place: the pessimistic weather conditions, tourists that only come during the summertime, a distance runner Olympic gold winner and relating it to people that are trying to “move the fuck away from hibernation,” roads that are named after random people, and those that are all-around clueless about their surroundings.

songs.full_title: All My Love by Noah Kahan
songs.title: All My Love

description.plain:
“All My Love” is an ode to an ex-lover, who has moved out of their hometown and moved on with their life. Though Kahan stayed behind, he still stayed in love. Despite this disparity, the singer holds no bitterness, and simply reminisces on the time when his ex-lover loved him back while also accepting the reality of their current distance.

Context for the separation can be found in earlier tracks such as “Glue Myself Shut” and “Maine” and, later, “Forever”.

songs.full_title: Your Needs, My Needs by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Your Needs, My Needs

description.plain: Shared by Kahan on X, “Your Needs, My Needs” is about the loss of a relationship after someone has left, with two different versions of the same story depicted throughout the track, offering a hopeful and a angry view. Kahan added that “Your Needs, My Needs” is “a song about Zoloft” (i.e. about depression) prior to playing the track at the Live from Fenway show, hinting that his experience of the loss led him to mental health struggles resulting in the need for the anti-depressant.

songs.full_title: No Complaints by Noah Kahan
songs.title: No Complaints

description.plain: Noah appears to address the struggles that can happen when you attempt to address mental health and related issues. Sometimes, things aren’t as bad as they were before, but you still feel numb and disconnected and it can be difficult to recognize that you can still complain because you aren’t where you may want to be.

Hope the skin heals where the pain enters

songs.full_title: Everywhere, Everything by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Everywhere, Everything

description.plain:
“Everywhere, Everything” is a track off of singer-songwriter Noah Kahan’s third studio album, Stick Season.

The track lyrically brings us through a journey of Kahan and his lover and Kahan’s hopes for the two of them to last for this lifetime and more. There are a number of allusions relating to death and the afterlife within the track, especially within the chorus. Sonically it fits well into Stick Season with recognizable acoustic guitar seen in most, if not all, tracks up to this point, but there is also electric guitar elements that have not really been introduced up until this point.

The track was first previewed in a TikTok video posted by Kahan on September 20, 2022. After the track’s release, as well as the few shows before, it became a staple on the Stick Season Tour.

songs.full_title: Northern Attitude by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Northern Attitude

description.plain: In this song, Kahan uses his upbringing in Vermont, a cold, harsh place, as a backdrop for a lifestyle focused on keeping one’s self and loved ones alive and comfortable through routine and physical preparation, at the expense of connection, community, and “living” over survival. In a moment of self-reflection, Kahan observes how hollow and lonely a life this mindset can result in one living, and although recognizing he may not be able to shed this mindset quickly, shows self-awareness and asks for patience as he attempts to overcome his nature in an attempt to connect with someone else (seemingly an ex-lover he had previously pushed away with this behaviour).

songs.full_title: The View Between Villages (Extended) by Noah Kahan
songs.title: The View Between Villages (Extended)

description.plain:
The We’ll All Be Here Forever reissue of Noah Kahan’s 3rd album, Stick Season, ends with an extended version of the standard edition’s closing track “The View Between Villages”.

After the original version of the song ends, voicenotes from Hazel Lewis and Melvin Coburn, residents of Noah’s hometown Strafford, Vermont, can be heard, before the climatic chorus repeats once again, this time with extra lines and rock-leaning production.

songs.full_title: Hurt Somebody by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Hurt Somebody

description.plain:
“Hurt Somebody” is Noah Kahan’s 2017 single from his debut EP also titled Hurt Somebody. Noah then went on to release another version of the track, featuring Julia Michaels.. Noah’s music video for “Hurt Somebody” is very literal, featuring him hurting himself in many different ways.

I wrote Hurt Somebody with the incredible Scott Harris in a writing room in Nashville, TN. I recorded the song with the equally incredible Joel Little in LA.
- Noah Kahan

songs.full_title: Paul Revere by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Paul Revere

description.plain:
The feeling of a place — where an untouched landscape, after years of preservation, finally yields to the inevitable march of progress. “Paul Revere” drifts from the folk nature of the original Stick Season tracks, introducing country into the expanded edition of the album.

The track’s title is a reference to the historical American military officer Paul Revere, who alerted Minutemen about incoming British troops as he was traveling through historic towns in central Massachusetts. With Kahan’s writing imbued with references to legendary figures from the area’s storied history, “Paul Revere” does not stray from this known path. While making references to U.S. revolutionary wars, “Paul Revere” showcases Kahan’s passion to leave his hometown, accompanying feelings that come with the inability to act on his desire, which is a common theme throughout Stick Season and its deluxe version. Kahan had shared his interpretation on social media, saying:

‘Paul Revere’ is about being tired about where you are, but being too tired to leave it. [It’s] about those dreams we have, but know we cannot realize. It’s viewing a city[’s] skyline as you fly into the tarmac, imagining a life there, while knowing the [entire] time that you don’t have enough courage to reach […] it. It’s the conversation at the local bar with a friend, where you both say, ‘we [have to] get the fuck out of here,’ and then the reassigned sadness that washes over you when you think about your parents, […] dog, or […] job. Sometimes [just] the dreaming is enough, even if it only makes your life easier for [just one] moment.

description.plain: Kahan continues his chronicles of life in Vermont, celebrating the mind-expanding potential of change, as exemplified by the opening of a Target superstore in a small town. The narrator talks about how he wishes the worst for someone he used to love, as mentioned at his performance at Fenway Park (2024).

songs.full_title: Growing Sideways by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Growing Sideways

description.plain:
“Growing Sideways” offers a deeply introspective exploration of themes such as mental health, emotional numbing, and the slow, nonlinear process of healing.

Released in 2022 as part of Kahan’s album Stick Season, “Growing Sideways” reflects his personal journey with therapy, medication, and self-discovery. The lyrics serve to highlight Kahan’s candid grappling of suppressed emotions, medication misuse, and detachment. Kahan additionally touches upon his fear of losing his sense of self while coping with his life’s lack of progression, revealing in an interview with CBC:

A fundamental fear of mine was that I had just drifted through life without any idea of who I was.

songs.full_title: She Calls Me Back by Noah Kahan
songs.title: She Calls Me Back

description.plain: In an interview with Rolling Stones, Noah says that “She Calls Me Back” is about a relationship hanging on by the skin of its teeth. The narrator is bitter about losing someone, even though something was problematic about the relationship from the beginning. The phone number in the song is a fake 8-digit number for a company in Vermont, and Noah isn’t entirely sure what the company specializes in. The fake number is used as though that relationship is falling apart as they call each other. The song was ideal for the setting the COVID-19 pandemic had on people who had to live apart from their loved ones, especially if those relationships were falling apart during that lockdown.

songs.full_title: Strawberry Wine by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Strawberry Wine

description.plain:
Noah Kahan’s “Strawberry Wine” explores themes of nostalgia, love, and the bittersweet passage of time, inspired by his grandfather describing the cremation of his father, Kahan’s great-grandfather.

Drifting away from Stick Season’s self-narrative, Kahan-leading framework, “Strawberry Wine” achieves the goal of having simply exist as they are, without “forcing it,” which Kahan speaks to in an interview with Atwood Magazine:

I wanted the attention to be paid to the story and to the, like you said, the space and the instrumentation leading the story instead of kind of having that panic of like, oh, I need to write these dank lyrics or else no one’s gonna care.

Kahan masterfully balances this tension, creating a poignant reflection on the intersection of memory and change. Showcasing verses that capture fleeting summer memories and a chorus that blends longing and acceptance, reflecting life’s impermanence, together, weaves a vivid scene of personal growth and the struggle of moving forward while holding on to the past.

songs.full_title: The View Between Villages by Noah Kahan
songs.title: The View Between Villages

description.plain:
Stick Season’s closing track, “The View Between Villages" is inspired by the scenic drive between South Strafford and Strafford, Vermont consisting of a majestic valley that has offered Kahan a sense of happiness, no matter life’s circumstances. However, when approaching the path leading to a bridge near Alger Brook Road, that peace fades, replaced by the anxiety of nearing home and the emotional weight that lives there.

Kahan crafted the song to mirror this experience, with its serene opening giving way to rising tension. Banjo, guitar, and drums build alongside the unease before resolving into a final, peaceful section punctuated by organ notes—a return to fragile calm. Proud of the track, he considers it a breakthrough, blending story and music in a way that reflects both his literal and emotional journey.

I think one of my biggest creative insecurities is my musicianship. I’m not a great guitar player. I never have a great vision about how the music part should sound. So I was really proud of being able to kind of start to try to develop vision musically. And I was happy to be able to tell that story musically.

—via Atwood Magazine

songs.full_title: Pain Is Cold Water by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Pain Is Cold Water

description.plain:
Pain Is Cold Water is an unreleased song from Noah Kahan, that he often plays on tour. It gained a lot of popularity during his Fenway Night 1 show in 2024, where he did a mash up of Pain Is Cold Water & Maine.

Written in Watertown, MA; the song is about the ups and downs of living with mental health issues.

songs.full_title: Young Blood by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Young Blood

description.plain:
“Young Blood” is the major label debut single by Noah Kahan. A fusion of youthful adventure and adulthood pressures to lose your individuality, the song is about remaining you against all the odds.

I wrote the song Young Blood when I had been in Vermont for a few months over the winter and was kind of trapped at my house due to a snowstorm and so I think that played a huge part in my songwriting and how I see the world.
- Noah Kahan

songs.full_title: Maine by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Maine

description.plain:
“Maine,” the closing track of Noah Kahan’s Cape Elizabeth EP, is a nostalgic song reflecting a lost relationship. It picks up the story told in “Glue Myself Shut” about a couple from Maine finding that their relationship isn’t working out and breaking up. The lyrics explore the feeling of “wanting to go back to that simpler time” of being together.

As Kahan mentioned in an interview, Maine was a song he worked on for multiple years, starting in 2017 and finishing it only a few weeks before it’s release.

“Maine” was premiered in a series of instagram livestreams Kahan did while self-isolating with his family home in Vermont during the Covid-19 pandemic in spring 2020.

songs.full_title: The Great Divide by Noah Kahan
songs.title: The Great Divide

description.plain: The Great Divide is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan which he says he wrote around February 2024. He says this song talks about how you can be close to someone yet know nothing about them. He first performed this song on July 18, 2024 at Fenway Park.

songs.embed_content: Read “The Great Divide” by Noah Kahan on Genius

annotatable.link_title: The Great Divide by Noah Kahan
annotatable.title: The Great Divide

body.plain: The Great Divide is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan which he says he wrote around February 2024. He says this song talks about how you can be close to someone yet know nothing about them. He first performed this song on July 18, 2024 at Fenway Park.

songs.lyrics:
6 ContributorsThe Great Divide LyricsLyrics From Live Debut, Live Performance & X Snippet

[Verse 1]
I can't recall the last time that we talked
About anything but looking out for cops
We got cigarette burns on the same side of our hands, but we ain't friends
We're just morons who broke skin in the same spot
But I've never seen you take a turn that wide
And I'm high enough to still care if I die
Well, I tried to read the thoughts that you'd worked overtime to stop
You said, "Fuck off," and I said nothing for a while

[Chorus]
You know I think about you all the time
And my deep misundеrstanding of your life
And how bad it must have been for you back then
And how hard it was to keep it all insidе
I hope you settle down, I hope you marry rich
I hope you're scared of only ordinary shit
Like murderers and ghosts and cancer on your skin
And not your soul and what He might do with it

[Verse 2]
You inched yourself across the great divide
While we drove aimlessly along the Twin State line
I heard nothing but the bass in every ballad that you'd play
While you swore to God the singer read your mind
But the world is scared of hesitating things
Yeah, they only shoot the birds who cannot sing
And I'm finally aware of how shitty and unfair
It was to stare ahead like everything was fine
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]
(Ooh) You know I think about you all the time
(Ooh) And my deep misunderstanding of your life
(Ooh) And how bad it must have been for you back then
(Ooh) And how hard it was to keep it all inside
(Ooh) I hope you settle down, I hope you marry rich (Ahh)
(Ooh) I hope you're scared of only ordinary shit (Ah-ah)
(Ooh) Like murderers and ghosts and cancer on your skin (Ah-ah)
(Ooh) And not your soul and what He might do with it

[Post-Chorus]
[Ah-ah / Mm-mm-mm-mm
Mm-mm-mm]

[Bridge]
Rage
[In small ways / Small wage]
Don't you wish that I could know
[You'd fade / You stayed]
To some place
I wasn't brave enough to go?

[Chorus]
I hope you settle down, I hope you marry rich
I hope you're scared of only ordinary shit
Like murderers and ghosts and cancer on your skin
And not your soul and what He might do with it
[Post-Chorus]
Ah-ah

[Instrumental Break]

[Outro]
I hope you threw a brick right into that stained-glass
I hope you're with someone who isn't scared to ask
I hope that you're not losing sleep about what's next
Or about your soul and what He might do with itEmbed

songs.full_title: Carlo's Song by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Carlo’s Song

description.plain: Carlo’s Song is about one of Noah’s friends who unexpectedly died young. It’s a tribute to him and a way to keep him memory alive

songs.embed_content: Read “Carlo's Song” by Noah Kahan on Genius

body.plain: Carlo’s Song is about one of Noah’s friends who unexpectedly died young. It’s a tribute to him and a way to keep him memory alive

songs.lyrics:
31 ContributorsCarlo’s Song Lyrics[Verse 1]
Do you remember drinking in the parking lot
By the trailhead?
I see you for a moment, then the morning comes
And it's wasted
We listen to "Only The Good Die Young"
And we laughed about its statement
We walked in the same direction, but we both got lost
In your angst and my impatience

[Chorus]
Did you find what you were looking for?
Some escape from your skin
You know that place you were dreaming of
Where all light comes in
I hope you know I grew my hair out long
And your sister's just fine
I keep burning my bridges down
Just to keep you alive

[Refrain]
Woo-oo-oo
Woo-oo, oo-oo-oo-oo
Woo

[Verse 2]
Do you remember looking from the fire tower at the sunset?
Jack White, prophetic on my speakers, "We Were Going To Be Friends"
Yeah, I guess I just got busy, only saw you every other weekend
Lord, I just moved to this city, hoping noise drowns out the regret
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]
But did you find what you were looking for?
Some escape from your skin
You know that place you were dreaming of
Where all light comes in
I hope you know I grew my hair out long
And your sister's just fine
I keep burning my bridges down
Just to keep you alive

[Refrain]
Woo-oo-oo
Just to keep you alive
Woo-oo, oo-oo-oo-oo
Woo

[Bridge]
They tell me grief is just love letting go
They say it like milk has been spilled on the floor
They say they don't know who I am anymore
Well, I just have never shown anger before

[Chorus]
Still haven't found what I'm looking for
Some escape from my sin
You know that place you been dreaming of
Where all light comes in
And I'll keep growing my hair out long
Just to cover my eyes
And I'll keep playing that goddamn song
If it keeps you alive
[Outro]
Woo-oo-oo
If it keeps you alive
Woo-oo, oo-oo-oo-oo
Woo
I just wanna keep you alive2Embed

songs.lyrics:

If I could give this all back
I would be home in the morning
I'd wake up in a cold sweat
Take a flight back to the city I was born in
And I would wipe myself clean
Of what I knew was unimportant
I'd want typical things
I'd try to fit back into all my old clothing

[Pre-Chorus]
And I would prove myself wrong
That all along, the problem was me
With all my bitterness gone
Happy, I'd be

And I'll put all my pieces back together
Where they belong, and I'll say
"I'm a mess, I'm a mess, oh God, I'm a mess"

And I'll help her set up her new apartment
And we'll get drunk, and she'll say
"Shit, you're a mess, you're a mess, good God, you're a mess
Oh, you're a mess, you're a mess, good God"

songs.full_title: Halloween by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Halloween

description.plain:
“Halloween” is the eleventh track on Noah Kahan’s third studio album, Stick Season. The song covers Kahan feeling haunted by the “ghost” of a person he used to know, meaning that he couldn’t get them out of his head.

The lyrics see him having a visible struggle with understanding this person, even after they’re not around each other anymore. This is likely because they weren’t letting anybody in and were a supposed “train wreck,” where this person was a complete mess, which was alluded to in the lyrics.

The lyrics see him having a visible struggle with understanding this person, even after they’re not around each other anymore. This is likely because they weren’t letting anybody in and were a supposed “train wreck,” where this person was a complete mess, which was alluded to in the lyrics.

songs.lyrics:
20 ContributorsHalloween Lyrics[Verse 1]
I'm sailin' away to a place I'm afraid of
The dawn isn't here, the sun hasn't rose
I'm drinkin' my days with the coastal longshoreman
They got money to make and children back home
The last that I heard, you were down in New Orleans
Workin' your days at The Print
I drink 'til I drown and I smoke 'til I'm burnin'
Your hands are all over my scent
I worry for you, you worry for me
And it's fine if we know we won't change
Collect every dream in these old empty pockets
In hope that I'll need them some day

[Chorus]
But the wreckage of you, I no longer reside in
And the bridges have long since been burnt
The ash of the home that I started the fire in
It starts to return to the Earth
I'm leavin' this town and I'm changin' my address
I know that you'll come if you want
It's not Halloween, but the ghost you dressed up as
Sure knows how to haunt, yes, it knows how to haunt

[Post-Chorus]
Mm-hmm-mm

It's an ode to the hole that I found myself stuck in
A song for the grave that I dug
There's a murder of crows in the low light off Boston
And I see your face in each one
I'm losin' myself in the tiniest objects
I'm seein' my life on a screen
I'm hearin' your voice in a strange foreign language
If only I learned how to speak

[Chorus]
But the wreckage of you, I no longer reside in
The bridges have long since been burned

I'm leavin' this town and I'm changin' my address

It's not Halloween, but the ghost you dressed up as
Sure knows how to haunt, yeah, you know how to haunt

Mm-hmm-mm (Ah-ooh, ooh)
Know how to haunt
Know how to haunt
Mm-hmm-mm (Ah-ooh, ooh)
Mm-hmm-mm (Ah-ooh, ooh, ooh)
Ah, ooh
Mm-hmm-mm (Ah-ooh-ooh, ooh-ooh)
[Outro]
I know that you fear that I'm wicked and weary
I know that you’re fearin' the end
But I only tell the truth when I'm sure that I'm lyin'
So I'm settin' sail once againEmbed

songs.full_title: Sink by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Sink

description.plain:
This was the first song written for Busyhead. Noah wrote it at 16, and after putting it on Soundcloud, he got signed to a record deal. Noah told Music Junkie Press that the song was about

the familiar feeling of trying to use love as a lifeline. It tells a story of constant change with the hope that love can remain constant.

songs.full_title: Glue Myself Shut by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Glue Myself Shut

description.plain:
On “Glue Myself Shut,” Noah Kahan pays tribute to the people in his life that have been good to him and have sacrificed a lot, despite himself taking it for granted.

The lyrics tell the story of a failed relationship between a guy and a girl. After the breakup, the narrator realizes how much their partner invested in them, and ponders the loss of that person.

“Glue Myself Shut” was premiered in the weeks before the release of the Cape Elizabeth EP in a series of Instagram livestreams that Noah Kahan did while staying in Vermont with his family during the Covid-19 pandemic in the spring of 2020. During one of those livestreams, Kahan initially said that the song probably won’t ever be released officially.

songs.full_title: Please by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Please

description.plain:
Please is the third song on Noah Kahan’s debut EP Hurt Somebody.

“Please” is about homesickness. I am able to be back home in Vermont less and less as things get crazier for me. I wanted to write a song that would remind me of my home, my dogs, my mom and dad.

songs.full_title: Godlight by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Godlight

description.plain:
Noah started performing and writing music when he was 8 years old and struggled for years to find any kind of success. “I did it because I loved it, and because it made me feel heard. I didn’t care if it was one person listening or many.” When Noah started to gain attention and rose to popularity, he struggled with finding the drive and motivation to continue, worrying about keeping the attention he was gaining, becoming depressed, and losing sight of the original reason he began creating music. “I thought a lot about what the younger version of me would think about me. I wrote this song trying to make him proud.”
- Paraphrased from Noah’s Instagram Story (6/30/21)

It's all mine

songs.full_title: Catastrophize by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Catastrophize

description.plain:
Catastrophize is the second song on Noah Kahan’s debut EP Hurt Somebody.

“Catastrophize” is a song I wrote in a frenzy, so I wanted it to feel frantic. I wanted to write a song that would paint as clear and honest a picture of myself and my struggles and vulnerability as possible. It’s a word my therapist told me about, and I just felt that it fit my personality [really] well. The song ended up being a big anthem to anxiety and fear and vulnerability.

body.plain:
Catastrophize is the second song on Noah Kahan’s debut EP Hurt Somebody.

“Catastrophize” is a song I wrote in a frenzy, so I wanted it to feel frantic. I wanted to write a song that would paint as clear and honest a picture of myself and my struggles and vulnerability as possible. It’s a word my therapist told me about, and I just felt that it fit my personality [really] well. The song ended up being a big anthem to anxiety and fear and vulnerability.

songs.full_title: Part of Me by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Part of Me

description.plain:
Part Of Me is a song about how deeply a passing interaction can impact you. It’s about recognizing that some people aren’t meant to stay for long.

— Noah Kahan, Twitter

songs.full_title: Howling by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Howling

description.plain: This song is directed at a future version of himself. The chorus is based on the sound of his dogs howling at the wind during a Vermont blizzard. The loneliness of that noise at that moment is what drove Kahan to write this song answering the questions about what the future may hold.

22 ContributorsHowling Lyrics[Verse 1]
Where to begin?
Oh, let's pretend we never met
So I can disappear a moment
Been trying to swim with both my hands behind my back
My dear I always feared the ocean
And, somehow, this one word in my mouth that's left unspoken

[Pre-Chorus]
I won't admit my parents split when I got sick
But I refuse to be a burden
And I said

[Chorus]
Is there something keeping me here for the minute, darling?
Did you find the key and what is the meaning of it?
'Cause honey, sometimes I feel this emptiness
Howling out
Is there something keeping me here for the minute, darling?
Did I lose my mind and and am I still looking for it?
'Cause I don't know why I feel this emptiness
Howling out
Howling out

[Verse 2]
"You’re not alone" the world is small
And I am sick of all the talk of finding purpose
Love comes and goes

And now
And somehow, I gained 15 pounds, but lost my focus
And I suffocate things slow
Until I'm just the black fly circling my bullshit
Ooh

You can't wait to throw them away

[Pre-Chorus]
You perseverate
And the truth might be a million miles away

Hide your secrets, disguise your weakness

Burn your bridges and leave no witnesses
All alone inside your busyhead
Your busyhead

You spend your days in wait for bad news

songs.full_title: If We Were Vampires (Spotify Singles) by Noah Kahan (Ft. Wesley Schultz)
songs.title: If We Were Vampires (Spotify Singles)
songs.title_with_featured: If We Were Vampires (Spotify Singles) (Ft. Wesley Schultz)

description.plain: This song is Noah Kahan’s cover of the song originally written by Jason Isbell and the 400 Unit, released in 2017. The theme of the song being that while the people who are the subject of the song desire to be together forever,  it is the limited time people have together that gives relationships meaning.

songs.lyrics:
9 ContributorsIf We Were Vampires (Spotify Singles) Lyrics[Verse 1: Noah Kahan]
It's not the long, flowing dress that you're in
Or the light coming off of your skin
The fragile heart you've protected for so long
The mercy in your sense of right and wrong
It's not your hands searching slow in the dark
Or your nails leaving love's watermark
It's not the way you talk me off the roof
Your questions like directions to the truth

[Chorus: Noah Kahan]
It's knowing that this can't go on forever
It's likely one of us will have to spend some days alone
Maybe we'll get forty years together
But, one day, I'll be gonе
One day, you'll be gone

[Verse 2: Wesley Schultz]
If wе were vampires, and death was a joke
We'd go out on the sidewalk and smoke
And laugh at all the lovers and their plans
I wouldn't feel the need to hold your hand
Maybe time running out is a gift
I'll work hard 'til the end of my shift
And give you every second I can find
And hope it isn't me who's left behind

songs.full_title: Fine by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Fine

description.plain:
“Fine” is a 2017 single by Noah Kahan. In Noah’s own words:

“Fine” which is kind of just a song I wrote to reassure myself.. about the path I was on, which is kind of the theme of a lot of the songs that I’ve written this past year and a half, just a way to tell myself I’ll be okay, even though things can seem turbulent, and figuring out a way to find balance.

songs.embed_content: Read “Fine” by Noah Kahan on Genius

songs.full_title: A Troubled Mind by Noah Kahan
songs.title: A Troubled Mind

description.plain:
“A Troubled Mind” is the opening track of Noah Kahan’s Cape Elizabeth EP, talking about the theme of ungrounded, excessive worries and fears.

In the spring of 2020, when the EP was released, the world was currently undergoing the Covid-19 pandemic. During that time, public life was restricted and many people around the world were required to stay at home, not being able to go to work, school, or to meet up with friends.

Noah Kahan had to leave New York City and went to Vermont to stay in his parent’s house with the rest of his family. As he mentioned in an interview, he would often spend hours just worrying about things, a feeling he took up for “A Troubled Mind.”

In the weeks before the EP’s release, Kahan regularly did Instagram livestreams in which he premiered songs from the EP, including “A Troubled Mind.” Sometimes, he was joined by his brother, Simon Kahan, who ended up contributing backing vocals to the song.

18 ContributorsA Troubled Mind Lyrics[Verse 1]
I told you, love, if you could see it through my eyes
You'd understand my fear of everything in sight
I know I'd quickly sell my heart for some advice
On how to ease a troubled mind
My brain's a dog asleep that I cannot let lie
Cloudy head, though I can't find a single silver lining
Guess there is no hope for me in sight
To ease this troubled mind

[Chorus]
I worry for the sun, yes, I worry for the snow

It takes me back

In hopes that maybe they'd say something relevant
To ease my worried head

And suddenly it all became so clear
It was sadly making sense

songs.full_title: Animal by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Animal

description.plain:
“Animal” is an unreleased song. Noah Kahan regularly played it in a series of instagram livestreams while self-isolating with his family home in Vermont during the Covid-19 pandemic in spring 2020.

Fans have recorded the livestreams and uploaded multiple performances of “Animal” on YouTube, such as this one and this one.

description.plain:
Noah Kahan posted a snippet of this song via TikTok on January 24 2022.

Kahan would later play “Shape of my Shadow” in full for the first time on tour at the Tampa, FL show, which was shared via Tiktok.

songs.full_title: Save Me by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Save Me

description.plain: This song talks about that one constant in a person’s life who has always been there to support and uplift you no matter how or who we are. No judgements, no conditions. Just pure genuine support and love. It could be referred to anyone from the person you love to the faith you hold on to.

songs.embed_content: Read “Save Me” by Noah Kahan on Genius

songs.lyrics:

It's not what you think
These tears aren't some sweet response to tragedy
Today I can't say why they fall
Honey, it's all chemical
Don't be deceived
And don't take my bitterness as empathy
Darling, it's a broken bridge
Can you still get over it?

[Chorus]
If you're not afraid of the water
You should dive right in
I'm not so brave, but I'm gonna
Give it a try
But it'll take a little while

[Verse 2]
Can you fix my flaws?
Are you a bad excuse for therapy?
How am I supposed to live
One foot out and one foot in?
I fear the fall
Right now I just can't find thе energy
Weighеd down by a ton of bricks
I'm forgetting how to swim

I'm not so brave, but I'm gonna
Give it a try
But it'll take a little while

I'll dive right in
And I can be brave, so I'm gonna
Give it a try

I'll dive right in

songs.lyrics:
11 ContributorsTidal Lyrics[Verse 1]
You knew me in my spiral
Happiness tidal, it comes and it goes
And I sank into the water
How I drifted farther away from the coast

[Pre-Chorus]
Sometimes, I get this feeling
I was breathing someone else's air
Two thousand miles away from home
Under that sky, I tried to make my peace with fear

[Chorus]
So I guess I'll build a boat and live alone
Lord, I'll be the lost one (Oh, oh)
Oh, I'll teach myself to swim and live in my head
And make sense of all my thoughts
And if I never reach the land or live again
Lord, I'll be just fine (Oh, oh)
Yeah, I'll drift until I'm dead, and until then
I'll be the lost one, I'll be the lost one

[Verse 2]
I fell into a pattern
Where nothing would matter if I didn't care
To be so close to a coastline
To know that in my life, I'd never be there

songs.full_title: Bad Luck by Noah Kahan

description.plain: This is a song about how the singer feels that their mental health is negatively affecting their ability to love and be loved. It’s a song about the fear that something within them is fundamentally broken. It’s not anyone’s fault, really. It’s just bad luck.

songs.full_title: Doors by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Doors

description.plain:
“Doors” is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan. There is currently no release date.

It was first teased on October 17, 2024, when Noah Kahan tweeted the lyrics to the bridge. Then, on November 29, 2024, he shared the corresponding audio on Instagram.

The track was debuted during a TikTok LIVE on December 27, 2024. It was then debuted live just over a week later, on January 6, 2025, during Noah Kahan’s first set at the Out Of The Blue Festival in Cancún, Mexico. He then performed it again the following day, during his second set.

songs.embed_content: Read “Doors” by Noah Kahan on Genius

It was first teased on October 17, 2024, when Noah Kahan tweeted the lyrics to the bridge. Then, on November 29, 2024, he shared the corresponding audio on Instagram.

The track was debuted during a TikTok LIVE on December 27, 2024. It was then debuted live just over a week later, on January 6, 2025, during Noah Kahan’s first set at the Out Of The Blue Festival in Cancún, Mexico. He then performed it again the following day, during his second set.

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsDoors LyricsLyrics From Live Performance

[Verse 1]
I grew up pretending sticks were little guns
I would point 'em at my dad, and he'd get mad
'Cause God forbid I'd hurt someone
I'd hurt anyone I could
Anyone who got too close, and anyone who wouldn't look

[Verse 2]
I was born into a one hundred-year storm
Foot of ice across Vermont
And in that dark, and in that frost, a heart was formed
Malcontented and unwarm
You were unprotected, not unwarned

[Chorus]
That I'm the trouble ahead, and I scream in my sleep
You put your money on red, I'm a sure bet at a losing streak
I keep showing you doors, but you can't opеn them up
It gets harder to see mе the closer you try to look

[Post-Chorus]
I just live here, babe, but you're the one who decided to knock
You knock
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Bridge]
Have you ever stared directly at the Sun?
Have you ever shared some closeness so exposed to have it spit back by someone?
So, forgive me if I jump
At the rattle of your keys, "Oh, are you leaving?", "No, babe, I'm just waking up"
But now what?
I'm left staring at the ceiling, listing reasons you should pack all your shit up

[Chorus]
I'm the trouble ahead, and I scream in my sleep
You put your money on red, I'm a sure bet at a losing streak
I keep showing you doors, but you can't open them up
It gets harder to see me the closer you try to look

[Post-Chorus]
I just live here, babe, but you're the one who decided to knock
You knock
I just live here, babe, but you're the one who decided to knock
You knock
But you knocked
You knocked

[Instrumental Break]

[Chorus]
I'm the trouble ahead, and I scream in my sleep
You put your money on red, I'm a sure bet at a losing streak
I keep showing you doors, but you can't open them up
It gets harder to see me the closer you try to look
[Post-Chorus]
I just live here, babe, but you're the one—
I just live here, babe, but you're the one—
I just live here, babe, but you're the one—
You're the one—, you're the one—
You're the one—
You're the one—, you're the one—
You're the one—, you're the one—

[Outro]
The [fuck?], why'd you knock?Embed

songs.full_title: Caves by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Caves

description.plain:
“Caves” details a relationship where both partners know they need to break up and move on, but are afraid to be the one to actually say the words.

Fans first heard the song when Kahan leaked a portion of the song on his TikTok for fans to help him pick his next single off his second studio album, I Was / I Am.

songs.full_title: Pain Is Cold Water (Live From Fenway Park) by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Pain Is Cold Water (Live From Fenway Park)
songs.title_with_featured: Pain Is Cold Water (Live From Fenway Park)

description.plain:
Performed at several tour stops this year, with fans eagerly anticipating its release, “Pain is Cold Water (Live from Fenway)” was given an extra special showcase under the spotlight of the Fenway Park lights during his momentous double-header shows in Boston, marking the final stops of Kahan’s We’ll All Be Here Forever North American tour. Fans hope that the live release will pave the way for a studio version of the highly anticipated track.

With a gentle, winding strum of an acoustic guitar, the stripped down, introspective track intricately explores Kahan’s struggle to reconcile his self-image with the idea of being in a relationship, as he reflected on the negative traits he perceived in himself.

Fans hope that the live release will pave the way for a studio version of the highly anticipated track.

With a gentle, winding strum of an acoustic guitar, the stripped down, introspective track intricately explores Kahan’s struggle to reconcile his self-image with the idea of being in a relationship, as he reflected on the negative traits he perceived in himself.

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsPain Is Cold Water (Live From Fenway Park) Lyrics[Spoken Intro]
This next song is called "Pain Is Cold Water". I wrote this song right here in Watertown, Massachusetts

[Verse 1]
I'm the tall glass of water you lost in your kitchen
I'm casually cruel like a senior prediction
Most likely to leave at the sign of a fork in the road
You look just like your father as the news was delivered
Cut a hole in my heart that bled into my liver
I miss being alone when it didn't mean being alone

[Verse 2]
And, if love was contagious, I might be immune to it
Pain's like cold water, your brain just gets used to it
Try to keep swimming, keep Dad's good word in my mouth
But they're fighting like dogs in the town across the river
Over a brand-new crosswalk that won't matter come winter
Lord, sometimes folks just need something to be angry about
What're you angry about?

[Chorus]
I ain't bitter 'bout much these days
In some ways, I'm damn lucky to be here
Oh, where the miners stayed in them good old days
Yes, real men used to sleep here
Oh, those roadside graves where my friends still lay in
I walk by just to weep here
They say killing time ain't a homicide
But a prayer for a leap yearSee Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also likeEmbed

songs.full_title: Wreckage Of You* by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Wreckage Of You*

description.plain:
“"Wreckage Of You*” is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan. It’s title and release date are yet to be revealed.

It was first teased on September 4, 2024, when Noah Kahan posted a minute-long video to Instagram of him singing some of the song whilst playing an acoustic guitar.

Over a month later, on October 12, 2024, he shared a snippet of the studio recording of the same part of the song to his Instagram Story. The audio appears to feature another male voice. Although Noah Kahan is yet to officially confirm who this is, the following day, he commented, “🥰🥰🥰”, on a video where a fan guessed Bon Iver.

songs.lyrics:
2 Contributors2010 LyricsLyrics From Instagram LIVE 1, 2 & 3

[Verse 1]
Lava lamp up in your room, looking like another planet's ocean
For a minute, I am frozen
In the room that we just smoked in
I know how long I've known you, but your dad was always working
We were both already broken
But found different ways to show it

[Chorus]
So, if I saw you, I'd say, "How are you?"
I would ask you how you've been
We'd be there after school, in your swimming pool
Like it's 2010
Oh-oh-oh-oh

[Post-Chorus]
Oh-oh, oh-oh
Oh-oh-oh-oh, mm
Oh-oh, oh-oh

[Verse 2]
Dress me up in your clothes, let's pretend we live in Paris
Let's talk shit about your parents
Let's smoke cigarettes and share 'em, yeah
The [?] due before our paths were parallel
We drank six of your mom's beers, threw up, and swore we'd never tell
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also likeAlternative Verse 2 Ending (Instagram LIVE 2)
[?] all the time go, though I [?] already [?]
I'm changing every minute, see you less and less each day

[Steady, where the time go?], though our sins would multiply
Ah, we were just thirteen years old tryna make the most out of our lives, mm

[Chorus]
But, if I saw you, I'd say, "How are you?"
I would ask you how you've been
We'd be there after school, in your swimming pool
Like it's 2010

[Chorus]

We'd be there after school, in your swimming pool
Like it's 2010

But it's like you're made of angel dust

[Outro: Noah Kahan]
Lacy, oh Lacy, it's like you're out to get me
You poison every little thing that I do
Lacy, oh Lacy, I just loathe you lately
And I despise my jealous eyes and how much they fell for you
Yeah, I despise my rotten mind and how much it worships you

songs.lyrics:
1 ContributorRocks in My Shoes [Unreleased] LyricsLyrics from TikTok Live (9/6/2022)

[Verse 1]
County line, I’m countin' down
Mailboxes until my house
But this place had a heartbeat
And it stayed
They all bought the mountains (?)
And nothing is the same

Well, I wonder if I'm gonna die
In the room I've lived in all my life
And I turn up the music
And I forget
Till it ends that I'm not ready to let go yet

[Chorus]
One day, I'm gonna cut it clear
Drive like Paul Revere
And when they ask me who I am
I'll say I'm not from around here

[Verse 2]
Why am I so stressed out all the time
Don't you know this town used to housе all the miners
Wherе dirt looked like gold
They found nothing
They turned and went home
Tell me that that don't mean something
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also likeRocks in my shoes and a half tank of gas
Pretend I’m a local and wave as cars pass
You told me a storm never knows why it’s coming
But knowledge of nature won’t stop folks from runnin’

[Chorus]
One day, I'm gonna cut it clear
Drive like Paul Revere
And when they ask me who I am
I say I'm not from around hereEmbed

songs.lyrics:
2 ContributorsBored Of My Bullshit LyricsLyrics From Instagram LIVE

[Verse 1]
"You are not who I thought"
I said, "I rarely am, unless you always thought that I was just a fool"
If I wrote a book of songs worth keeping
It'd be short and full of plot holes and foreshadowings of doom

[Pre-Chorus]
I woke up inside a nightmare
Parading as my wildest dreams
And I snorted Ambien
I'm a deer in three and four quarter inch bike headlights
When they hit my eyes, I feel like a fucking alien

[Chorus]
I am bored of all my bullshit
Nothing's yours if you can't hold it
Astronauts don't like the feeling when they land
Is my heart still in your stomach?
Are you cured of my emotions?
I am overweight, and, God, I miss my band
I miss my band

[Post-Chorus]
Yeah
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Verse 2]
Burnt my lungs on the ash of every song I started writing
But got bored and smoked instead
Called my mom, and found the only
Things worth fighting are the things you want the most out of your head

[Chorus]
I am bored of all my bullshit
Nothing's yours if you can't hold it
Astronauts don't like the feeling when they land
Are you cured of my emotion?
Is my heart still in your stomach?
I am overweight, and, God, I miss my band

[Outro]

Parading as my wildest dreams
And I snorted Ambien
I am a deer in five and three quarter inch bike headlights
When they hit my eyes, I feel like a fucking alienEmbed

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsAll My Love (Live from Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1]
How have things been? Well, love, now that you mention it
My folks still talk, but they speak in these two-word sentences
I'm sayin' too much, but you know how it gets out here
No winter coat could keep out all the cold of your atmosphere

[Chorus]
We once sang
"Retrograde", we'd shake the frame of your car
Now I know your name but not who you are
It's all okay, there ain't a drop of bad blood
It's all my love, you got all my love
I'm still out here with the pills and the dogs
If you need me, dear, I'm the same as I was
It's all okay, there ain't a drop of bad blood
It's all my love, you got all my love
You got all my love

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsMen’s Room* LyricsLyrics from Instagram LIVE

[Verse 1]
I'm waiting for God in the men's room
Feeling more and more like a metaphor
For everything wrong with the men's room
Any mess I make, I do not say sorry for

[Verse 2]
[I threw my face through?] the lens of a camera
I say, "Look at you, who the hell are you?"
And, deep in my head, there's an answer
But it's raining out, I got shit to do

[Chorus]
Oh-oh, oh-oh, I'm drinking again
I'm kicking a can on down the road just to see where it lands
Oh-oh, oh-oh, to spinning my wheels
'Cause all of the secrets I can't keep sit outside of the hills
So, I'll die on this hill

[Verse 3]
I'm floating around like a phantom
Like a stray dog, like I was laid off
And hope that I found is a cancer
Hope my bitterness finally paid off
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]
Oh-oh, oh-oh, I'm drinking again
I'm kicking a can on down the road just to see where it lands
Oh-oh, oh-oh, to spinning my wheels
'Cause all of the reasons I can't sleep sit outside of the hills
So, I'll die on this hill

[Bridge]
With the light of the snow and the Exit 2 sign
And the rhythmless notes from my mother's wind chimes
Even the snakes in the grass get afraid of the past
I won't answer for it if I don't let myself ask
'Cause I'll be nothing, and that's fine
I'll be nothing, and that's fine
I'll be nothing, and that's fine
That's fine

[Outro]

Feeling more and more like a metaphor
For everything wrong with the men's room
Any mess we make, we do not say sorry forEmbed

Liberal rednecks get drunk on a dirt road
Attention-deficit kids in their gym clothes
Paper bags drift wherever the wind blows

1 ContributorDrunk In Room 10* LyricsLyrics From X & TikTok Video

[Verse 1]
"Your turn", you said, "We ain't finished yet
I've got another half hour, and the nurse just left
And I stole a Marb Red from that surgeon's desk
With the wife and two kids and a seven-year itch"

[Verse 2]
So, I said, "Sharks, I guess, or being burnt alive"
And you said, "There are far, far worse ways to die"
And I looked like a child as I started to cry
And you looked like a bride in your hospital whites

[Chorus]
We're supposed to be kids, I love you, and fuck this
Let's get drunk in room 10 under the halide lamps
And we'll close our eyes, and the ceiling will spin
And we'll wake close to the river where the college kids swim
And we know it won't last while we float on our backs
But we'll stay in the water 'til the nurses get mad
They'll say, "What the fuck are you doing? You know it's worse if she drinks
Don't you dare wake her up, she's got somewhere to be"

[Post-Chorus]
Somewhere to be

Let's drive for no reason, let's see where these wheels land
Let's grind down the curve of this earth

Where I'd go with my friends to get drunk
Used to wish I meant anything to anywhere, to anyone

I won't ever let her go
Yee

songs.full_title: You're Gonna Be Fine* by Noah Kahan
songs.title: You’re Gonna Be Fine*

description.plain: Kahan first previewed “You’re Gonna Be Fine*” on an Instagram Live on June 9th, 2022. The track follows the insecurities of Kahan, who lays it all out on the table, but it also doubles as an appreciation to a loved one, who assures Kahan that negative things happen sometimes and that is an okay thing. Since the initial performance of the track, it does not seem to have been played or mentioned by Kahan.

annotatable.title: You're Gonna Be Fine*

body.plain: Kahan first previewed “You’re Gonna Be Fine*” on an Instagram Live on June 9th, 2022. The track follows the insecurities of Kahan, who lays it all out on the table, but it also doubles as an appreciation to a loved one, who assures Kahan that negative things happen sometimes and that is an okay thing. Since the initial performance of the track, it does not seem to have been played or mentioned by Kahan.

songs.lyrics:
1 ContributorYou’re Gonna Be Fine* LyricsLyrics from Instagram Live

[Verse 1]
Today I didn’t step outside
You say “That’s fine, 'cause you’re working on yourself and that counts”
And I haven’t done a lot of things right
You say “Good, way to rule all the bad things out”
When I told you that I hate my body and and my skin
You said I don’t know how beautiful I am
You say you got front row seats to me and you promise it’s flawless from beginning to end

[Chorus]
I wanna believe you but don’t how, 'cause you’re a shitshow inside out
What if the lights go down, I take my bow and you’re just bored of me?
We’ve seen these films a thousand times and in the end you always cry
Curtain close, I take my bow, you stand applauding every time
You said “You’re gonna be fine, kid”
You’re gonna be fine, kid

[Verse 2]
Today I didn’t lose my mind, you said
“Alright, it ain’t a race, but baby if it was
I’d be there at the finish line with a sign that says ‘That dude right there’s my number one’”

[Chorus]
I wanna believe you but don’t how 'cause you’re a shitshow inside out
What if the lights go down, I take my bow and you’re still bored of me?
We’ve seen this film a thousand times towards the end I always cry
The curtain closed, the show is done, you stand applauding every time
Said, “You’re gonna be fine, kid”
You’re gonna be fine, kidSee Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also likeEmbed

If I could give this all back
I would be home in the morning
I'd wake up in a cold sweat
Take a flight back to the city I was born in
I would wipe myself clean
Of what I knew was unimportant
I'd want typical things
I'd try to fit back into all my old clothing

[Pre-Chorus]
I would prove myself wrong
That all along, the problem was me
With all my bitterness gone
Happy, I'd be

Where they belong, and I'll say
"I'm a mess, I'm a mess, oh, God, I'm a mess"

And I'll help her set up hеr new apartment
And we'll gеt drunk, and she'll say
"Shit, you're a mess, you're a mess, good God, you're a mess
You're a mess, you're a mess, good God"
"Boston!"

I guess the stage was my mask
I forgot the way I looked before I wore it

songs.full_title: Porch Light by Noah Kahan
songs.title: Porch Light

description.plain:
“Porch Light” is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan. There is currently no release date.

It was debuted during a TikTok LIVE on December 27, 2024. It was then debuted live just over a week later, on January 6, 2025, during Noah Kahan’s first set at the Out Of The Blue Festival in Cancún, Mexico. This came just hours after he tweeted the lyrics to the chorus.

body.plain:
“Porch Light” is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan. There is currently no release date.

It was debuted during a TikTok LIVE on December 27, 2024. It was then debuted live just over a week later, on January 6, 2025, during Noah Kahan’s first set at the Out Of The Blue Festival in Cancún, Mexico. This came just hours after he tweeted the lyrics to the chorus.

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsPorch Light LyricsLyrics From TikTok LIVE (December 27, 2024) & Live Debut

[Verse 1]
I would ask you how you've been, it's all over the internet
Oh, yeah, I mean we knew that after all
If you're looking for an autopsy or a half-assed half-apology
Then I think you picked the wrong time to make this call

[Verse 2]
It is not irrelevant that you stopped taking your medicine
But I'm giving you the benefit 'cause it's raining now
I'll tell you how the weather is, and I'll slip into some eloquently
Rambling mixed-messaging, I should shut you down

[Refrain]
But you don't, and it's cold, and it's cold, and it's cold
And I don't know, I'm alone, I'm alone, I'm alonе, I'm alone

[Verse 3]
I hope you tell mе that you're winding down, that you lost the taste to face the crowd
That whatever made you famous made you sick
But you can only do what pain allows, it ain't up to you to make it out
And there ain't no shame in calling this thing quits

[Refrain]
But you don't, and you don't, and you don't, and you don't, and you don't
You're a ghost, you're a ghost, you're a ghost, you're a ghost
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]
And your poison is spreading to my lungs
I ain't holding breath, ain't holding any faith at all
And I'll pray for you, be in pain for you
I'll leave the porch light on
And I'm heartbroken each morning when it's me that turns it off

[Refrain]
So it goes, so it goes, so it goes

[Verse 4]
You act like we just sit up here and wait for you to reappear
But, baby, there are bills to pay and your dad's road needs salt
And I try to drown out all the talk, the eyeballs in the parking lots
And tell people it ain't me you want, but I guess you're my fault

[Refrain]
But they don't, you're a ghost, you're a ghost, you're a ghost, you're a ghost
And I choke, and I choke, and I choke, and I choke on the

[Chorus]
Poison you're spreading to my lungs
I ain't holding breath, I ain't holding any faith at all
And I'll pray for you, be in pain for you
I'll leave the porch light on
Heartbroken each morning when it's me that turns it off
[Refrain]
So it goes, so it goes, so it goes

[Chorus]
Poison spreading to my lungs
I ain't holding breath, ain't holding any faith at all

I'll leave the porch light on
And I'm heartbroken each morning when it's me that turns it off

You're a ghost, you're a ghost, you're a ghostEmbed

Ooh-ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh
It's been a long year

[Verse 1: Noah Kahan]
Would we survive in a horror movie?
I doubt it, we're too slow moving
We trust everyone we meet

Stare at a drive-in screen

We didn't know that the sun was collapsing

Boston!
We cried, "Oh, oh-oh, oh, oh-oh, oh"

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsStick Season (Live From Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1: Noah Kahan]
As you promised me that I was more than all the miles combined
You must've had yourself a change of heart like halfway through the drive
Because your voice trailed off exactly as you passed my exit sign
Kept on drivin' straight and left our future to the right
Now I am stuck between my anger and the blame that I can't face
And memories are somethin' even smoking weed does not replace
And I am terrified of weather 'cause I see you when it rains
And Doc told me to travel, but there's Covid on the planes

[Chorus: Noah Kahan]
And I love Vermont, but it's the season of the sticks
And I saw your mom, she forgot that I existed
And it's half my fault, but I just like to play the victim
I'll drink alcohol 'til my friends come home for Christmas
And I'll dream each night of some version of you
That I might not have, but I did not lose
Now you're tire tracks and one pair of shoes
And I'm split in half, but that'll have to do

[Post-Chorus: Noah Kahan]
Boston!
One, two, three

[Verse 2: Noah Kahan]
So I thought that if I piled something good on all my bad
That I could cancel out the darkness I inherited from Dad
No, I am no longer funny 'cause I miss the way you laugh
You once called me "forever," now you still can't call me back

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsTourist Trap LyricsLyrics From Instagram LIVE

There's a tiny tourist trap a few miles off the interstate
And I watch as it empties out
The New Yorkers came to justify their sins and meditate
Then got cold and headed back south
You were drinking at the bar where all the staff head after work
I sat down and got drunk next to you
Well, you asked where I had been
And just how long I'd been here for
"Twenty years, but I'm checking out soon"

I said, "Baby, ain't nothing breaks a darkened heart quite likе a ray of light"
To see it glow, to watch it fade
Who knows who I will be when you rеturn next summertime?
I'll be counting down the days
I'll be counting down the days
Just give me a reason to staySee Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also likeEmbed

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsGrowing Sideways (Live from Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1]
So I took my medication and I poured my trauma out
On some sad-eyed, middle-aged man's overpriced new leather couch
And we argued about Jesus, finally found some middle ground
I said, "I'm cured"

[Verse 2]
And I divvied up my anger into thirty separate parts
Keep the bad shit in my liver and the rest around my heart
I'm still angry at my parents for what their parents did to them
But it's a start

[Pre-Chorus]
But I ignore things and I move sideways
'Til I forget what I felt in the first place
At the end of the day, I know there are worse ways to stay alive

[Chorus]
'Cause everyone's growing and everyone's healthy
I'm terrified that I might never have met me
Oh, if my engine works perfect on empty
I guess I'll drive
I guess I'll drive

[Spoken Post-Chorus]
Alright, Boston!

Keeps rushin' me

I don't mind, I'll watch it go
Yeah, it's better to die numb than feel it all

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsOrange Juice (Live From Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1]
Honey, come over
The party's gone slower
And no one will tempt you
We know you got sober
There's orange juice in the kitchen
Bought for the children
It's yours if you want it
We're just glad you could visit

[Chorus]
Feels like I've been ready for you to come home
For so long
That I didn't think to ask you where you'd gone
Why'd you go?

[Post-Chorus]
You said
You said
You said my heart has changed and my soul has changed
And my heart, and my heart
Now my face has changed, and I haven't drank
In six months on the dot

[Verse 2]
See the graves as you pass through
From our crash back in '02
Not one nick on your finger
You just asked me to hold you
But it made you a stranger
And filled you with anger
Now I'm third in the line up
To your Lord and your Savior
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]
Feels like I've been ready for you to come home
For so long
That I didn't think to ask you where you'd gone
So why'd you go then?

[Post-Chorus]
And you said
You said
You said my heart has changed and my soul has changed
And my heart, and my heart
And my life has changed, that this town had changed and you had not, no, not at all
That the world has changed, don't you find it strange
That you just went ahead and carried on?
'Cause you know I'd say, the last time I drank
I was face down, passed out there on your lawn
Are we all just crows to you now?
Are we all just pullin' you down?
You didn't put those bones in the ground
You didn't put those bones in that cold, hard ground

[Outro]
Honey, come over
The party's gone slower
And no one will tempt you
We know you got sober
There's orange juice in the kitchen
Bought for the children
It's yours if you want it
We're just glad you could visit
[Spoken Outro]
Oh, boy, thank you so much
I don't deserve this shit, thank you!

Thank you so much… and I'm really sorry about my first pitch, I know it was bad, I'm sorry guys! And I just wish I could stay up here forever 'cause I'm gonna remember it for the rest of my life! And there's some moments you just don't want to end. And I've been working so hard to get here… we've been working so fucking hard, and we're so grateful and we're so excited that we're here. I have never, never been more proud of a group of people than these people behind me playing music for me tonight. These are people that worked their fucking asses off, that— I mean, I found this dude, he was, he was giving me coffee in the studio we were working and making the album in. He picked up a guitar and played the solo, and I said, "Why don't you come on tour with me?". Look at him now, eh? I mean, this is Nina's first ever real fucking tour, look at her! It's the biggest tour you've ever done, Dylan? I mean, Alex was playing fucking Nashville bars and Broadway. And Marcos was, ha, was living right up there where you could see the fucking park and grew up here in Boston and played in a wedding band and played every fucking venue in this city and grinded his ass off for this shit. I remember we played House of Blues, and he had tapped on my shoulder, and he just said thank you, and I wish I could show him that we'd be playing Fenway in about two years later! So, um… I wanna thank my crew as well for putting this show on for two years straight! I wanna thank Fenway Park for having me out today; thank you so much Fenway! And there is nobody in the world that I wanna thank more than New England; I love you all so much! I don't pretend to be a representative of where we're from; we're all representatives of where we're from, and I think what's special is that we're all alike in a lot of ways, and I'm happy that this album was able to capture some of that. Um, but this album has brought me closer to people that, uh, I would never would've met otherwise, like you guys, and, um, I've seen every comment, I've seen every, uh, like, word of support, I've seen you guys at every show. Um, I have fallen in love with this, uh, with this city, with this area, and with all of you guys, and, um, I will be here as long as you'll have me, New England! Wearing flannel and shit! Uh, this next song is, uh, about being a national for the Northeast, being cold as hell! Uh, Boston, thank you so much for the greatest night of my young life, or old life, whatever, thank you!Embed

The only time I got to praying for a red light
Was when I saw your destination as a deadline
"This is normal conversation, babe, it's all fine"
Making quiet calculations where the fault lies
This is good land, or at least it was
It takes a strong hand and a sound mind

[Verse 2]
The college kids are getting so young, ain’t they?
They're correcting all the grammar on our spray paint
And I even gave up driving after nightfall
I got tired of the frat boys with their brights on
This is good land, or at least it was
It takes a strong hand and a sound mind

[Pre-Chorus]
It makes me smile to know when things get hard
Ooh-ooh, you'll be far
Ooh-ooh, you’ll be far from here
And, while I clean shit up in the yard
Ooh-ooh, you'll be far
Ooh-ooh, you'll be far, far from here

[Spoken]
Boston!
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Chorus]

The birds will still sing
Your folks will still fight
The boards will still creak
The leaves will still die
We ain't angry at you, love
We'll be waiting for you, love

[Post-Chorus]
We’ll all be here forever

You're goddamn right we will

We spent so long just getting by
That's the thing about survival
Oh, who the hell, who the hell likes livin' just to die? Not I

For always

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsThe View Between Villages (Live From Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1]
Air in my lungs
'Til the road begins
As the last of the bugs
Leave their homes again
And I'm splitting the road down the middle
Well, for a minute, the world seemed so simple

[Verse 2]
I feel the rush of my blood
I'm seventeen again
No, I am not scared of death
I got dreams again
It's just me and the curve of the valley
And there is meaning on Earth, I am happy

[Pre-Chorus]
(Oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh)

[Chorus]
Passed Alger Brook road, I'm over the bridge
A minute from home, but I feel so far from it
The death of my dog, the stretch of my skin
It's all washin' over mе, I'm angry again
The things that I lost here, thе people I knew
They got me surrounded for a mile or two
The car's in reverse, I'm grippin' the wheel
I'm back between villages and everything's still
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Bridge]
(Oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh)
(Oh-oh-oh, oh-oh-oh)
(Ah)
(Ah)

[Outro]
The things that I lost here, the people I knew
They got me surrounded for a mile or two
A left at the graveyard, I'm driving past ghosts
Their arms are extended, my eyes start to close
The car's in reverse, I'm grippin' the wheel
I'm back between villages and everything's still

[Spoken Outro]
Boston, who's ready to get fucking sweaty?
Who's ready to get sauced at the Lansdowne?
Who wants to get fucking sticky?
I love you guysEmbed

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsDial Drunk (Live from Fenway Park) Lyrics[Instrumental Intro]

[Spoken Intro]
New England!

[Verse 1]
I'm rememberin' I promised to forget you now
But it's rainin' and I'm callin' drunk
And my medicine is drownin' your perspective out
So I ain't takin' any fault
Am I honest still? Am I half the man I used to be?
I doubt it, forget about it, whatever
It's all the same anyways

[Chorus]
I ain't proud of all the punches that I've thrown
In the name of someone I no longer know
For the shame of being young, drunk, and alone
Traffic lights and a transmitter radio
I don't like that, when they threw me in the car
I gave your name as my emеrgency phone call
Honey, it rang and rang
Evеn the cops thought you were wrong for hangin' up
I'd dial drunk, I'll die a drunk, I'd die for you

[Post-Chorus]
New England!
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Verse 2]
I'm untetherin' from the parts of me you'd recognize
From charmin', to alarmin' in seconds
I'll be bedridden, I'll let the pain metastasize
But that's morning, I'll forget it
And the dial tone is all I have

[Chorus]
I ain't proud of all the punches that I've thrown
In the name of someone I no longer know

songs.lyrics:
4 ContributorsPaul Revere (Live from Fenway Park) Lyrics[Verse 1]
County line, I'm countin' down
Mailboxes until my house
This place had a heartbeat in its day
Vail bought the mountains, and nothing was the same
Yes, the boys are drunk, the sun is high
Well, their license plates "Live Free or Die"
It just ain't that simple, it never was
We'll drink 'til New Year's, then they'll leave me to clean up

[Chorus]
One day, I'm gonna cut it clear
Ride like Paul Revere
And, when they ask me who I am
I'll say, "I'm not from around hеre"

[Spoken Post-Chorus]
This song's for you, Boston!

[Verse 2]
I'll leave bеfore the road crew's out
Before them joggers, looking way too proud
And I'll turn up the music and I'll forget
Until it ends, that I'm not ready to let go yet

[Chorus]
One day, I'm gonna cut it clear
Ride like Paul Revere
And, when they ask me who I am
I'll just pretend I didn't hear
It's typical, I fear
Folks just disappear
And, when they ask me who I am
I'll say, "I'm not from around here"
See Noah Kahan LiveGet tickets as low as $105You might also like[Post-Chorus]
Oh-ohh
I'll say, "I'm not from around here"

[Outro]
But I'm in my car, and I see the yard
The patch of grass where we buried the dog
And the world makes sense behind the chain-link fence
If I could leave, I would've already left
But I'm in my car, and I see the yard
The patch of grass where we buried the dog
And the world makes sense behind the chain-link fence
If I could leave, I would've already left
I would've already left
I would've already left
Would've already left

[Instrumental Outro]

[Spoken Outro]
Boston, this next song...is for any children of divorce here in the audience. This is "All My Love". Boston, I fucking love you!Embed

body.plain:
“Angry Yet*” is an unreleased song by Noah Kahan. There is currently no release date.

It was debuted during a TikTok LIVE on December 27, 2024.

songs.lyrics:
3 ContributorsAngry Yet* LyricsLyrics From TikTok LIVE (December 27, 2024)

[Verse 1]
I'm writing again, and I know it's boring you to death
The run on sentences, the overuse of ampersands
I'm living here now, and it ain't bad but it ain't Amsterdam
You said I'm good at writing hooks and good at shaking hands

[Verse 2]
I'm keeping close track of every action and its consequence
So I can call foul when I fuck up and nothing happens next
Signing my name for fans but always leave an asterisk
'Cause I'm a smoking, bad, free-throwing pro who has the yips

[Chorus]
I want boredom, I hate autumn, I got means, now I want ends
I want the last minutes of morning when I am not angry yet
I want youth, I wanna to puke out all the bullshit in my mouth
I want to see me as you see me and not how I see mysеlf
I'm okay with burning out, I'm okay with falling off
I am not that damn important, I surrender, I give up
So, givе me one more minute stretch of cigarette smoke in your car
You can play me my old demos, I'll make promises to start

[Verse 3]
I'm trying to live in a moment that I won't get back
I'm trying to give a shit 'bout some shit that I ain't supposed to have
I'm staring at cars heading north and wishing I could hop in
And hope a small town can make me feel far more insignificant
